etymology.description: 士(士) (shì, "scholar") (ritual axe) + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") -> representation of rituals to acquire favor -> auspiciousness
etymology.interpretation: The character 吉(jí) combines 士(士) (shì, "scholar") symbolizing a ritual axe and 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth"), suggesting ancient rituals for gaining ancestral or divine blessings. This association leads to the meaning of 'auspicious' or 'lucky'.

examples.chinese: 今天是吉日(今天是吉日)，适合举办婚礼(適合舉辦婚禮)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān shì jírì, shìhé jǔbàn hūnlǐ.
examples.english: Today is an auspicious day, suitable for holding a wedding.

examples.chinese: 他抽到吉牌(他抽到吉牌)。
这次考试结果吉利(這次考試結果吉利)，大家都感到欣慰(大家都感到欣慰)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè cì kǎoshì jiéguǒ jílì, dàjiā dōu gǎndào xīnwèi.
examples.english: The results of this exam were auspicious, and everyone felt relieved.
